intro: Cistanthe parryi var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This perennial herb is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and gravelly soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations.
